business_summary: This database supports an internal enterprise operations platform that combines: (1) task assignment/checklists/delegation with reminders, attachments, due dates and completion tracking; (2) sales lead → enquiry → quotation → order follow-up tracking; (3) plant/operations data capture (SMS/CCM/pipe mill QC and production checklists); (4) store & purchase workflows (indents, approvals, GRN, repair follow-up); (5) HR/admin workflows (users/access control, leave requests, visitor gate pass, travel/resource requests, recruitment resumes); and (6) subscription/document management with approvals and payment history. The schema indicates multiple modules stitched together, with many ‘FKs’ implemented as free-text names/codes rather than strict relational keys, plus some duplicated/legacy tables (e.g., users vs users_staging vs login; re_coile vs re_coiler; enquiry tracking in several tables).

delegation.description: One-time delegated tasks (manager-to-employee or department) with planned dates, reminders and completion/submission tracking; includes delay calculation and optional image/attachment requirement.
foreign_keys: color_code_for likely references a color/priority legend table (not present in schema)
name, given_by likely reference users.user_name (string-based, not enforced)
department likely references departments.department (string-based, not enforced)

column_descriptions.task_id: Unique identifier for the delegated task.
column_descriptions.created_at: When the task record was created.
column_descriptions.department: Department of the assignee or the task context.
column_descriptions.name: Assignee name (person expected to do the work).
column_descriptions.frequency: Recurrence type (appears to be one-time here).
column_descriptions.task_start_date: Planned start time/date for the task.
column_descriptions.image: Optional image URL/path associated with the task.
column_descriptions.delay: Time delta between planned and actual/submission (can be negative if early).

delegation_done.description: Event/ledger of task completion or extension actions for delegation tasks (audit trail).
foreign_keys: name, given_by are string references to users.user_name (not enforced)

column_descriptions.task_id: Delegation task identifier being acted upon.
column_descriptions.created_at: When the completion/extension event was logged.
column_descriptions.image_url: Proof image for the event if required.
column_descriptions.name: Actor or assignee name at time of event.
column_descriptions.id: Unique identifier for this event row.

working_day_calender.description: Reference calendar table for working dates with week and month attributes (day names stored in Hindi).

column_descriptions.week_num: Week number within year or fiscal calendar.
column_descriptions.id: Surrogate key for the calendar row.

checklist.description: Recurring checklist tasks (often daily/weekly/monthly) assigned to users/departments with reminders, optional attachments, admin confirmation, and submission tracking.

column_descriptions.task_id: Unique identifier for a checklist instance (often one row per occurrence/date).
column_descriptions.department: Department or area for the checklist responsibility.
column_descriptions.name: Assignee.
column_descriptions.planned_date: Planned due datetime stored as text (ISO-like).
column_descriptions.task_start_date: When the checklist task starts/becomes active.

users.description: Primary user/employee directory with authentication fields and extensive access-control configuration across modules (checklist, store, subscription/document, etc.).

column_descriptions.user_name: Display/login name (used widely as text FK in other tables).
column_descriptions.password: Password (appears stored in plain text; security risk).
column_descriptions.system_access: Enabled systems/modules list (e.g., HRMS, STORE AND PURCHASE).
column_descriptions.subscription_access_system: JSON of systems/pages allowed for subscription/document module.
column_descriptions.verify_access_dept: Departments for which user can verify.

users_staging.description: Staging/import table for users (onboarding pipeline) prior to insertion into users; supports active/inactive.
primary_keys: id (not guaranteed non-null per schema; but functions as identifier)

column_descriptions.id: Staging user identifier (may match final users.id).

login.description: Legacy/alternate authentication table duplicating users fields; likely from older app version.

departments.description: Master list of company departments with optional HOD and contact number.

column_descriptions.department: Department name (used widely as text FK).

locations.description: Master list of physical/functional locations/areas used for housekeeping/assign_task.

assign_task.description: Operational/housekeeping task assignments by location/area with frequency, HOD oversight, optional attachment confirmation, and completion status.
foreign_keys: task_id appears to be a business key that often equals id
department likely references locations.location (string-based) rather than departments.department
given_by, name, doer_name2, hod likely reference users.user_name (string-based)

column_descriptions.task_id: Task identifier (stored as text; often same as id).
column_descriptions.name: Primary assignee group/person (e.g., Housekeeping Staff).

maintenance_task_assign.description: Maintenance task scheduling and execution tracking for machines/equipment, including sound/temperature checks, attachments, priorities, costs, and departments.
foreign_keys: serial_no likely references form_responses.serial_no or form_responses.tag_no (equipment registry) (string-based)

form_responses.description: Equipment/master data capture form for assets (purchase info, warranty, maintenance schedule, documents, department/location and tag/serial).

column_descriptions.tag_no: Internal tag/asset code (appears same as serial_no in samples).

indent.description: Line-level indent/requisition records for store & purchase: requested items, quantities, approvals, and time delay between planned vs actual processing.
foreign_keys: item_code likely references dropdown.item_code (string-based) or external item master (not present)

column_descriptions.sample_timestamp: Submission timestamp for the indent line.
column_descriptions.indent_number: Final indent number (may be assigned later).

indent_approvals.description: Approval actions for indents (multi-approver workflow) with status, remarks and approval time.
foreign_keys: approver_id likely references users.id or users.employee_id (ambiguous; stored as text)

indent_requests.description: Header-level indent request entity (one indent_no with department, priority, purpose). Likely intended as parent of indent_items and approvals, though indent table also stores line-like data.
foreign_keys: indent_no likely corresponds to indent.indent_number or request_number (not enforced)

indent_items.description: Items under an indent request header (normalized line items): item name, quantity, and available stock snapshot.
foreign_keys: indent_id -> indent_requests.id (likely) OR indent.id (ambiguous due to naming)

store_grn.description: Goods Receipt Note (GRN) bill tracking with admin/GM approvals and bill closure status.
foreign_keys: party_name likely references supplier master (not present)

column_descriptions.planned_date: Planned processing/approval date-time for the GRN/bill.
column_descriptions.sended_bill: Whether bill has been sent/forwarded for approval.

repair_followup.description: Repair gate pass lifecycle tracking with multiple stages (planned/actual/delay per stage) and overall gate pass status.
foreign_keys: party_name likely references vendor master (not present)

enquiry_to_order.description: Sales enquiry records with customer details, items/quantities (JSON-like text), follow-up scheduling, and conversion-to-order fields (PO, payment, transport).
foreign_keys: company_name may map to clients.client_name (not enforced)

column_descriptions.item_qty: JSON string listing items and quantities.
column_descriptions.actual: Actual completion date of planned milestone.
column_descriptions.customer_order_hold_reason_category: Reason category if order is on hold.
column_descriptions.planned_days: SLA planned days for a milestone.

enquiry_tracker.description: Follow-up log/tracker for enquiries/leads capturing stage changes, next call scheduling, order received status, and hold/no-order reasons. Appears partially overlapping with enquiry_to_order and fms_leads.
primary_keys: id (nullable per schema; but acts as identifier when present)
foreign_keys: enquiry_no likely references fms_leads.lead_no or enquiry_to_order.en_enquiry_no (mixed values)

column_descriptions.enquiry_no: Lead/enquiry identifier (mixed: EN-xx, LD-xxx, even person name).

fms_leads.description: Lead management table (CRM) capturing lead intake, enquiry receipt, follow-ups and eventual order details; many fields stored as text (including dates/numbers).
primary_keys: id (text; likely unique lead internal id)
foreign_keys: lead_no likely referenced by enquiry_tracker.enquiry_no and leads_tracker.lead_no (but inconsistent)

column_descriptions.item_qty: JSON string of items and quantities.
column_descriptions.followup_next_call_date: Next call date for follow-up stage.
column_descriptions.followup_next_call_time: Next call time for follow-up stage.

leads_tracker.description: Tracker table intended for lead follow-up snapshots, but sample/categorical patterns indicate columns are mis-mapped or data inserted in wrong order; treat as unreliable/legacy.

column_descriptions.lead_no: Lead number (intended, but appears corrupted in sample).

dropdown.description: Central picklist/configuration table for CRM/quotation/order screens: stores allowed values for many dropdown fields (sources, payment modes, reasons, item catalog snippets, consignor/consignee templates, etc.).

column_descriptions.created_at: When this configuration row was created.

clients.description: Customer master data for sales with assigned salesperson and client segmentation/type.
foreign_keys: sales_person_id likely references a salesperson master/users.id (but users.id is BIGINT; not enforced)

client_followups.description: Outbound calling/follow-up log for existing clients with optional actual order capture.

make_quotation.description: Quotation header with consignor/consignee details, commercial terms, item list (JSONB), and generated PDF URL.
primary_keys: id (nullable in schema report but functions as quotation record id)
foreign_keys: company_name may map to clients.client_name (not enforced)

column_descriptions.items: JSONB list of quoted items (code, qty, rate, gst, etc.).

size_master.description: Product dimension master for pipe/sections (item type, size, thickness) used by ERP enquiries and possibly production/quotation selection.

enq_erp.description: ERP-style enquiry demand capture by product dimensions and customer with quantity and sales executive.

subscription.description: Subscription/renewal lifecycle tracker for services (software, rent, telecom, etc.) with multi-stage planned/actual dates, delays, approvals, and renewal counting.
foreign_keys: subscription_no referenced by approval_history, payment_history, subscription_renewals (string-based)

approval_history.description: Approval audit trail for subscription approvals with notes and approver identity.

payment_history.description: Payments recorded against subscriptions (mode, transaction id, document link).

column_descriptions.insurance_document: Uploaded proof/document link (field name suggests reused template).

subscription_renewals.description: Renewal events for subscriptions with approver and price at renewal time.

subscription_master.description: Subscription/document classification master for companies, document types, categories and whether renewal filter is enabled.

documents.description: Document management repository for company/personal documents with optional renewal dates and tags, and soft-delete.

column_descriptions.serial_no: Internal serial for document (business key grouping).
column_descriptions.image: Document file URL (often Google Drive link).

sharedocuments.description: Outbound document sharing log capturing who a document was shared with and by what method.

visitors.description: Visitor gate pass register: visitor identity, visit purpose, person to meet, approval workflow, in/out times, and closure flag.

person_to_meet.description: Master list of employees available for visitor meeting selection with phone numbers.

leave_request.description: Employee leave application workflow with multi-level approvals (manager/HR/commercial head) and linkage to user account.

request.description: Generic request table reused for multiple request types (travel booking, manpower/resource request, etc.) indicated by fields like type_of_travel, education, request_quantity.

ticket_book.description: Ticket booking/billing records for travel with bill images and employee codes for requester and booked person.

resume_request.description: Recruitment candidate pipeline capturing resume, experience, interview scheduling, and candidate/joining status.
foreign_keys: req_id likely references request.request_no (if linked) (not enforced)

systems.description: System/module registry providing system names and frontend links for navigation.

sms_register.description: Steel Melting Shop (SMS) register capturing heat/sample information (sequence, ladle, furnace) with temperature and links for prefilled/update forms.

hot_coil.description: Hot coiler process/checklist capture (temperatures per strand, supervisors, remarks) with update link.

column_descriptions.sms_short_code: Short code linking to SMS/heat (business reference).

tundish_checklist.description: CCM tundish operation checklist per heat/sequence including casting speed and temperature with unique_code and update link.

qc_lab_samples.description: QC lab chemical test results for SMS batches/heats with final composition values and report image.
foreign_keys: sms_batch_code likely ties to SMS batch coding (not enforced)
unique_code may relate to other SMS records (not enforced)

pipe_mill.description: Pipe mill production/run log capturing equipment checks (turbine/blower), gas readings, time window, production quantity, and responsible staff.
foreign_keys: recoiler_short_code may reference re_coiler/re_coile hot_coiler_short_code (not enforced)

laddle_return.description: Ladle return record capturing temperatures before/after purging, operators involved, reason, and photo proofs.

laddle_checklist.description: Ladle preparation/maintenance checklist (cleaning, nozzle checks, plate life) with staff names and unique_code.

re_coile.description: Recoiler/hot coiler welding/operation capture (legacy variant). Likely duplicates re_coiler with slightly different types.

re_coiler.description: Recoiler operation capture (preferred/current variant) similar to re_coile.

master.description: Loose/denormalized master for maintenance/task metadata (doer, departments, given_by, priority). Possibly used to populate dropdowns or as an early design artifact.

all_loans.description: Finance module: master list of loans with amounts, EMI, start/end and documents.

request_forclosure.description: Finance module: requests to foreclose/close loans including requester and request date.

collect_noc.description: Finance module: tracking NOC collection after loan closure with closure request date and boolean flag.

payment_fms.description: Generic payment request/approval tracker (likely finance management system) with up to 3 stages planned/actual dates and delays plus attachments.

plant_visitor.description: Internal plant visit request workflow (different from visitor gate pass): request for visits over a date range, approval fields and requester info.

suggested_semantic_schema:
DOMAIN OVERVIEW
- This is a multi-module internal operations database for a manufacturing company.
- Major functional areas:
  1) Tasking: checklist, delegation, housekeeping/area tasks, maintenance tasks.
  2) Sales CRM: leads/enquiries tracking, quotations, client master and follow-ups.
  3) Store & Purchase: indents, approvals, GRN, repair follow-up.
  4) HR/Admin: users & access control, leave requests, visitor gate pass, travel/resource requests, recruitment.
  5) Subscriptions & Documents: subscription lifecycle with approvals, payments, renewals; document repository and sharing.
  6) Plant operations logs: SMS/CCM/pipe mill/QC checklists.

KEY ENTITIES (CANONICAL NAMES)
- Employee/User: users (id, user_name, employee_id, department, role, access fields)
- Department: departments (id, department)
- Location/Area: locations (location_id, location)
- Delegated Task: delegation (task_id, given_by, name, department, planned_date, submission_date, status, delay)
- Delegation Event/Audit: delegation_done (id uuid, task_id, status, created_at, next_extend_date)
- Checklist Task Instance: checklist (task_id, frequency, planned_date, task_start_date, submission_date, status/admin_done)
- Housekeeping/Area Task: assign_task (id, department=area/location, frequency, task_start_date, submission_date, status)
- Maintenance Task: maintenance_task_assign (id, task_no, serial_no, machine_name, task_start_date, actual_date, task_status, priority, maintenance_cost)
- Asset Registry: form_responses (id, serial_no/tag_no, machine_name, department, maintenance_schedule)
- Indent (Store Request): indent (id, request_number, requester_name, item_code, request_qty, request_status, approved_quantity)
- Indent Approval: indent_approvals (id, indent_id, approver_id, status, approval_date)
- GRN Bill: store_grn (grn_no, grn_date, party_bill_amount, approved_by_admin, approved_by_gm, close_bill)
- Repair Gatepass Follow-up: repair_followup (gate_pass_no, planned/actual delays, stage statuses)
- Lead/Enquiry:
  - fms_leads (lead_no) for lead intake
  - enquiry_to_order (en_enquiry_no) for enquiry-to-order pipeline
  - enquiry_tracker for follow-up logs (note: enquiry_no mixes EN and LD)
- Quotation: make_quotation (quotation_no, quotation_date, items jsonb, pdf_url, grand_total)
- Client: clients (client_id, client_name, sales_person_id)
- Client Follow-up: client_followups (followup_id, client_name, sales_person, date_of_calling)
- Visitor Gate Pass: visitors (id, visitor_name, date_of_visit, approval_status, status IN/OUT)
- Person-to-meet master: person_to_meet
- Leave Request: leave_request (id, employee_id, from_date, to_date, request_status)
- Subscription: subscription (subscription_no, start_date, end_date, approval_status)
- Subscription Approval History: approval_history (approval_no, subscription_no)
- Subscription Payments: payment_history (subscription_no, payment_mode, transaction_id)
- Subscription Renewals: subscription_renewals (subscription_no, renewal_no)
- Document: documents (document_id, serial_no, document_name, category, renewal_date)
- Document Sharing Log: sharedocuments

JOIN/RELATIONSHIP GUIDANCE (IMPORTANT FOR TEXT-TO-SQL)
- Many relationships are NOT enforced with foreign keys; joins frequently require matching on text fields:
  - users.user_name is referenced as given_by/name/sales_person_name in many tables.
  - users.employee_id is referenced by leave_request.employee_id and HR/travel/ticket modules.
  - departments.department is referenced as plain text in users.department, checklist.department, delegation.department, indent.department.
  - locations.location is referenced as assign_task.department (area-based naming).
- Subscription-related joins:
  - subscription.subscription_no = approval_history.subscription_no = payment_history.subscription_no = subscription_renewals.subscription_no
- Indent approvals:
  - indent_approvals.indent_id likely = indent.id
- Maintenance asset link:
  - maintenance_task_assign.serial_no often matches form_responses.serial_no or form_responses.tag_no

METRICS & ANALYTICS READY FIELDS
- Task timeliness: delegation.delay, checklist.delay, maintenance_task_assign.delay, indent.time_delay_1, subscription.time_delay_1/2/3.
- Completion rates: status fields (Done/Yes/no etc.). Normalize casing for analysis.
- SLA comparisons: planned vs actual fields across sales, subscriptions, indents, repair followup.
- Sales pipeline: lead_source, enquiry_status, current_stage, followup_status, is_order_received.

DATA QUALITY / NORMALIZATION NOTES
- Status and frequency values have inconsistent casing and sometimes different types (text vs boolean).
- Several date/time fields are stored as TEXT in some tables (fms_leads, enquiry_tracker, checklist.planned_date).
- leads_tracker appears corrupted/unreliable; prefer fms_leads and enquiry_to_order/enquiry_tracker for CRM reporting.
- Duplicate/legacy tables exist (login vs users; re_coile vs re_coiler). Prefer users and re_coiler.

SUGGESTED CANONICAL DIMENSIONS FOR A TEXT-TO-SQL AGENT
- dim_user(user_id, user_name, employee_id, department, role)
- dim_department(department)
- dim_location(location)
- dim_date(working_day_calender)

SUGGESTED CANONICAL FACT TABLES
- fact_delegation_task(delegation)
- fact_delegation_event(delegation_done)
- fact_checklist_task(checklist)
- fact_area_task(assign_task)
- fact_maintenance_task(maintenance_task_assign)
- fact_indent(indent) and fact_indent_approval(indent_approvals)
- fact_grn(store_grn)
- fact_repair_followup(repair_followup)
- fact_lead(fms_leads) and fact_enquiry(enquiry_to_order) and fact_enquiry_updates(enquiry_tracker)
- fact_quotation(make_quotation)
- fact_subscription(subscription) with related approval_history/payment_history/subscription_renewals
- fact_visitor(visitors)
- fact_leave(leave_request)

QUERYING TIPS
- When asked for 'tasks', clarify whether it refers to delegation vs checklist vs maintenance vs assign_task.
- When joining by person, use consistent name fields and consider trimming/case-insensitive matching.
- For 'delay', prefer numeric/interval columns where available; otherwise compute from planned/actual after casting text to date.
